title: New York Chad Lieberman Chats about Minuscule Artjustick Cell Phone
text: New York Chad Lieberman Chats about Minuscule Artjustick Cell Phone , 13 September 2015 -- 1888 PressRelease - Top Rated PPC Expert Chad Ian Lieberman describes how a pen-like device easily becomes a usable cell phone device.Internet marketing expert, PPC entrepreneur and technology lover Mr. Chad Lieberman recently organized a professional peer-to-peer meet-up to discuss the impact of technology on the future of mankind, during which many different futuristic technologies were analyzed in detail. One such technology is that of the Minuscule Artjustick Cell Phone, which is currently one of the smallest mobile telephone devices in existence. Describing it further, Mr. Chad Ian Lieberman stated that the concept of the Minuscule Artjustick phone was developed and first shown at the RATEC technology convention held recently held in Japan. "The convention featured a number of futuristic cell phone device concepts," he added, "but my attention was especially piqued by the Artjustick technology. It comes with a usable display screen and keyboard which is accessed by turning the phone to its side." He further expounded, stating that what jumped at him about the Artjustick cell phone was its extremely small size. This, he stated, made the phone ideal for everyone who doesn't fancy using bigger phones, or for whom having bulky things would be inconvenient to their business. The phone can easily be carried undetected on one's person, which is a big selling point for the technology. "The functionality of gadgets today and in the future has been significantly improved by technological advances," he noted emphatically, stating that futuristic cell phone technology is aimed at improving convenience without sacrificing functionality in the process. The minuscule Artjustick cell phone is literally the size of a pen, which is just difficult to fathom. However, the size in no way interferes with its usability, if the demonstration at the RATEC convention is anything to go by. Chad Lieberman New York described the device, stating that the pen-like cell phone projects a functional display and keyboard, which can be used just as well as any cell, phone we have today, even better. In conclusion, he expressed excitement at the direction taken by future technology, stating that he couldn't wait to see the next crop of futuristic devices on demonstration in coming conventions. "At this rate, we're in for an unbelievably cool future, one that you cannot even begin to imagine!"
